lines.text:
[Talking to Sandy]
It's up to you now. When I get that alien to the shack, you push the plunger.

[Taylor runs towards the shack; yelling]
Alieeeeen, alien, alien, come on.

[Taylor reached the shack and sits down against the shack; yelling]
Come on Sandy, You've gotta push the plunger.

[Sandy pushes the plunger, but the wire is not properly configured]
The wire, Sandy, push it.
[Sandy puts the wire on the plunger whilst Taylor falls over against the alien, then Sandy pushes the plunger and then the Shack blows up]
Oh, now listen Sarge, this ain't no jungle... this the United States. You're home! You've come back home Sarge...
You're not going to convince me you're Joe Taylor!
Greg's dead honey, we can't do anything for him.
I used to have a music box like this...
What's the matter?
Beth, she gave it to me on my ninth birthday. I'll never forget it because she was so excited about it... she bought it six months before...
[breaks down and starts crying]
Rattlesnakes carry germs.
I'm telling you kids not to go down to the lake, please!... It's full of hunters this time of year now.
No Chance... No Help... No Escape!
Aliens ain't human, you know. But they could take human form.
All right Fred, I ain't listening to no more.

[going directly to the water department shed and Alien encounter]
This is crazy...
Yah, I know it's crazy. I got the advantage... I'm hunting him and he don't know it, com'n...
Sarge said that Alien was here for an invasion... that Alien came here only for sport to get him some trophies and we are the prized game.
Hubba, hubba boy let's get with it! I'm not going to tell you again, now get out here!
You never been hunting before.
No, and I don't plan to.
Ohhh! good sport, as long as you follow the rules.
I could never kill an animal.
Depands on the animal and who's doing the hunting. Besides I eat what I kill. and the sport is in the hunting and the tracking not in the kill.
Sarge, this guy here says he's seen some of your flying saucers.
You've seen those flying critters. Feisty little things aren't they?
Yeah, they attacked our van.

[taking the scouts into the wilderness]
All right men, today's the day we're going to go into the wilderness. Now, all my life I've waited to take a group of men like you into the wilderness. Now these are hallowed mountains. Roamed by great Indian tribes like the Apache, Iroqui, Chippawa, and Hoppi.

[inquisitive]
Did they kill Custer?
No, those were the Sioux and Cheyenne who lived on the Great Plains. The Hoppi lived in these mountains. They raised beans. They were a bean-raising tribe.
[giggles from the other boy scouts]
Now we are never lost with our compass. As you can see. Now the streams lead to the lake and the lake leads to the Ocean. Coarse it does.
[puts his compass away and prepares the scouts]
Now I want you to pick up a branch or a rock and take it home to mom or dad as a memento of our trip. No rattlesnakes, they carry germs. All right men... dismissed.
